data.title: guardian.co.uk Football
data.text:
The final

Juventus 0 - 0 AC Milan (aet; Milan won 3-2 on penalties)

Andriy Shevchenko finally broke the deadlock in a penalty shoot-out after two hours of football.

Minute-by-minute match report

Red, white and black's heady mix

Michael Walker: Even the statues in Albert Square seemed to be nodding in agreement that the first all-Italian European Cup final was a definitive restating of Italian football's rediscovery.

'Nul point' final plainly a pain in Spain

The match dubbed the Eurovision Pong contest by the Daily Mirror also received nul point from Spain, writes Robert Pryce.

The Italian wall can be breached

Milan's success over Juventus in a penalty-shoot lived up to the spectators' hopes, writes Kevin McCarra.

Weary but well behaved Italian fans go home

Thirty-thousand weary Italian football fans, some ecstatic with joy, others deep in losers' gloom, left Manchester for the trip home.

Semi-final second legs

Juventus 3 - 1 Real Madrid (Agg: 4-3)

Dire defending from Madrid enabled Juventus to run amok and set up the first ever all-Italian champions League final.

Minute-by-minute match report

Inter Milan 1 - 1 AC Milan (Agg: 1-1)

AC Milan go through on away goals

Obafemi Martins equalised for Internazionale, but Andrei Shevchenko's goal takes Milan into the final.

Minute-by-minute match report

Semi-final first legs

AC Milan 0 - 0 Internazionale

Milan's footballing powerhouses ground the life out of each other in sweltering San Siro.

Minute-by-minute report

Real Madrid 2 - 1 Juventus

A dubious second-half winner from Roberto Carlos gave Real the slenderest of leads to take to Turin.

Minute-by-minute report

Quarter-finals, second leg

Manchester United 4 - 3 Real Madrid (Aggregate: 5 - 6)

A Ronaldo hat-trick ended Manchester United's Champions League hopes despite a thrilling 4-3 win over Real Madrid at Old Trafford.

How United's players shaped up last night

Minute-by-minute match report

Night of drama leaves Ferguson to ponder what might have been

Sir Alex Ferguson was dignified in defeat until talk turned to Steve McManaman's inclusion in Real Madrid's side.

Third cut is deepest for Beckham

Tomasson comes very late to Milan's rescue

A Jon Dahl Tomasson goal deep into injury time gave Milan a 3-2 win over Ajax and set up a semi-final derby against Internazionale.

Inter and Juve into semis

Cynicism prevails to challenge mighty Real

There was something so excruciatingly cruel about Inter Milan's Champions League victory over Valencia, writes John Carlin.

Quarter-finals, first leg

Real Madrid 3 - 1 Manchester United

First leg: The visitors were made to resemble a pub team for 70 minutes, but a late van Nistelrooy strike means they still have a glimmer of hope.

How United's players shaped up

Five classic United comebacks

Figo eclipses becalmed Beckham

Luis Figo's impressive goal against Manchester United acted as a reminder that he is not prepared to relinquish his position at Real Madrid to David Beckham.

Figo eclipses becalmed Beckham

United trapped in Zidane's web

Italian press chide mundane Milan

Italian newspapers criticised AC Milan today for betraying their roots in playing out a defensive 0-0 draw with Ajax.

Spain's also-rans nicely poised

Christian Vieri ensured Inter take a one-goal lead to Valenica, while Javier Saviola bagged a priceless equaliser for Barcelona in Turin.

Second Phase: round six

Wenger in need of solidity and humility

Kevin McCarra: Arsenal's high-water mark in the Champions League was a quarter-final appearance in 2001: now their estimation of themselves turns out to have been overstated.

Valencia 2 - 1 Arsenal

Two goals from John Carew sent the Gunners crashing out of the Champions League.

Gunners exposed as stand-ins crack

Minute-by-minute match report

Newcastle 0 - 2 Barcelona

A calamitous Titus Bramble error and awful finishing from Craig Bellamy made little difference - woeful Bayer Leverkusen couldn't do Newcastle any favours against Inter Milan.

Shearer shows glimpses of old glories

Minute-by-minute match report

Deportivo 2 - 0 Man United

Deportivo la Coruna comfortably beat an inexperienced Man Utd side in a Champions League bore-athon.

Minute-by-minute match report

Lokomotiv Moscow 1 - 0 Real Madrid

Ronaldo secured Real Madrid a Champions League quarter-final place with a first-half goal that gave the European champions the win they needed.

Second Phase: round five

United in clear over weakened team

Manchester United will not be punished for fielding their C team against Basle, giving them free rein to put out their ladies side against Deportivo La Coruna. Probably.

Manchester Utd 1 - 1 FC Basle

Minute-by-minute match report

Arsenal 1 - 1 Roma

Both sides sorely needed a win from this game, but that did not prove to be a cue for elevated performances.

Capello rages at Keown's 'acting'

Minute-by-minute match report

Real Madrid 3 - 1 AC Milan

Real Madrid were elegant enough in their victory over Milan, but the slackness that has beset them this season had not quite been purged.

Newcastle name Vieri in race row

Newcastle United have submitted a formal complaint to Uefa alleging racist abuse by the Internazionale striker Christian Vieri towards Lomana LuaLua.

Internazionale 2 - 2 Newcastle

Minute-by-minute match report

Newcastle name Vieri in race row

Second phase: round four

Ajax 0 - 0 Arsenal

Arsenal may be making serene progress in the Premiership but it seems they continue to find the Champions League more of a grind.

Vieira strives in vain to crack the Ajax wall

Minute-by-minute report

Newcastle 3 - 1 Bayer Leverkusen

Alan Shearer made short work of a woeful Bayer on what turned out to be a very good night to be a Magpie.

Minute-by-minute report

Juventus 0 - 3 Manchester United

Juventus, an institution of proud achievement, were turned into record-book fodder by Manchester United.

Giggs basks in golden glow of Italian acclaim

Keane makes strong case for the defence

Minute-by-minute match report

Second phase: round three

Manchester United 2 - 1 Juventus

Wes Brown scored his first (non-own) goal in 111 games, leaving Manchester United within a point of the quarter-finals.

Minute-by-minute report

Jim White: Comment

Round-up

Bayer Leverkusen 1 - 3 Newcastle

Newcastle's second-string strikers bagged the goals that won all three points for Sir Bobby on his 70th birthday.

Minute-by-minute match report

Arsenal 1 - 1 Ajax

Sylvain Wiltord put Arsenal ahead, but a mistake by Ashley Cole gifted Ajax an equaliser inside twenty minutes.

Minute-by-minute match report

Bergkamp gets sharp reminder of home truths

Wenger woe moves to the home front

Arsenal have found that their tactics are not cutting the mustard in the Champions League: there will be severe pressure on them to perform in Amsterdam.

Second phase: round two

Barcelona 3 - 1 Newcastle Utd

Dani was amongst the goals as Barcelona proved to have the better of two poor defences.

Minute-by-minute match report

Manchester United 2 - 0 Deportivo La Coruna

Manchester United squandered no end of chances, but a Ruud van Nistelrooy brace was enough to win them the points.

Minute-by-minute match report

Arsenal 0 - 0 Valencia

A sharing of Champions League points at Highbury was proof of parity of esteem between these distinguished clubs.

Valencia find Henry to be a paper tiger

Minute-by-minute match report

Litmanen clinches Ajax victory against Roma

While Gerard, Emile and chums were twiddling their thumbs at home, Liverpool reject Jari Litmanen was clinching victory for Ajax against Roma.

Eight jewels to emerge from Champions League rubble

Kevin McCarra: Ahem. The heightened rivalry of the great football nations should give us a luminous octet.

Second phase: round one

Newcastle 1 - 4 Internazionale

A goal down after one minute and a blubbing-like-a-big-girl Craig Bellamy down after six, Newcastle's evening started badly and went quickly downhill.

Min-by-min match report

Roma 1 - 3 Arsenal

There were no tears in Rome, where a Thierry Henry hat-trick punished the home team's early audacity.

Min-by-min match report

FC Basle 1 - 3 Manchester United

Two Ruud van Nistelrooy goals in 90 seconds turned this match around just when it seemed Manchester United were about to begin the second phase with a defeat.

Minute-by-minute match report

Second phase: the build-up

Marksmen, heroes and Dodgy Coppers

Wot, no Liverpool? Here's a big, massive, in-depth team by team guide to the remaining sides in the Big Cup.

Crumbs of comfort after a night of despair

Imagine travelling across Europe only to see your side knocked out of the Champions league by some minnows. Then imagine bumping into the players by chance afterwards to tell them exactly what you thought of their display. Joel Rookwood did just that.

Arsenal till I die

Thierry Henry talks to Guillem Balague about the enormous debt of gratitude he owes the Gunners and their chances of lifting the European Cup.

Bullish Basel looking for reprise

FC Basel were ranked bottom of the 32 teams at the start of the Champions League. Christian Gross, the manager who has led them into the last 16 of the competition, looks back on a job well done.

It looks like pain in Spain

Can a team recently humbled by Manchester City aspire (realistically) to win the Champions League? Paul Wilson assesses United's chances.

Second phase: the draw

Robson savours role reversal

Newcastle have Barcelona, Internazionale and Bayer Leverkusen for Champions league company. Nobody said it was going to be easy for Sir Bobby's great escapologists.

European reaction to the draw

Arsenal handed toughest of tough draws

The look on David Dein's face said it all. With so many big teams swimming around, the Arsenal vice-chairman knew his side's Champions League draw would be tough. But this tough?

First phase: week six

Feyenoord 2 - 3 Newcastle

They almost blew it, but Craig Bellamy's late, late winner, coupled with a Juve win in the Ukraine, enabled Newcastle to scrape through to the second phase.

Minute-by-minute match report

Manchester United 2 - 0 Bayer Leverkusen

If scoring with a nice volley in a completely meaningless Champions League match counts as answering your critics, then that's what Juan Sebastian Veron did.

Minute-by-minute match report

FC Basle 3 - 3 Liverpool

Oh dear. Liverpool fought back from three down to go out of the Champions League in a blaze of glory. Nevermind, they qualified for the Uefa Cup anyway. The poor sods.

Minute-by-minute match report

Premiership leaders count the cost of elimination

Houllier lays blame at Gerrard's feet

Arsenal 0 - 0 PSV Eindhoven

Despite playing for 55 minutes with 10 men, Arsenal not only held but could easily have beaten a hugely disappointing PSV Eindhoven. Nevermind, they won group A anyway.

Minute-by-minute match report

Robson needs a helping hand

Newcastle are expecting no favours as they attempt to pull off a remarkable late qualifiaction for the riches of the Champions League second phase.

Feyenoord yearn for qualified success

Group E: It will come as a mighty boost to Newcastle United's European ambitions to discover that Feyenoord's indisputable spark, Pierre van Hooijdonk is out with a fractured ankle.

Robust Liverpool fall short

Why can't English side's win in Europe? Paul Wilson on why these pesky European's refuse to roll over.

First phase: week five

Borussia Dortmund 2 - 1 Arsenal

Group A: Not even David Seaman's new haircut (ie the old one - shorter) could prevent Arsenal from a fourth successive 2 - 1 defeat. Nevertheless they are through to the second-phase.

Minute-by-minute match report

Liverpool 0 - 1 Valencia

Group B: Another slick Valencia performance ensured that Liverpool's Champions League prospects now teeter precariously. Rufete's sole 34th minute strike earned the Spaniards a deserved victory.

Minute-by-minute match report

Newcastle United 2 - 1 Dynamo Kiev

Group E: Devoid of any second phase hope just a week ago Newcastle's chances of progressing were revitalised courtesy of Gary Speed and some bloke called Shearer.

Minute-by-minute match report

Maccabi Haifa 3 - 0 Manchester United

Group F: Sir Alex Ferguson endured one of the most humiliating defeats of his Old Trafford career as the mighty Maccabi managed to secure a lifeline for their qualification hopes.

Minute-by-minute match report

Bye bye Bayern - but who's to blame?

Bayern Munich are on their way out of Europe. Where did it all go wrong?

Del Bosque calm as Real crash again

Defeat to Roma last night leaves Real Madrid without a win in six matches. But, as their boss points out, at least his team "have won something in the last three years - unlike Barcelona".

First phase: week four

Arsenal 1 -2 Auxerre

Group A: Arsenal never really recovered from the shock of Auxerre's stunning opener.

Minute-by-minute report

Spartak Moscow 1 - 3 Liverpool

Group B: Michael Owen was the hat-trick hero as Liverpool made history by becoming the first English club to beat Spartak in Russia, ever.

Minute-by-minute report

Olympiakos 2 - 3 Manchester United

Group F: Sir Alex Ferguson's arrogance nearly cost his side the three points after he withdrew Ryan Giggs and David Beckham with a third of the match still remaining.

Minute-by-minute report

Newcastle 1 - 0 Juventus

Group E: Full back Andy Griffin, with a little help from the otherwise on-song Gianluigi Buffon in the Juve goal, helped the Magpies to a famous win which kept their slim Champions League hopes alive.

Minute-by-minute report

First phase: week three

Auxerre 0 - 1 Arsenal

Group A: A Gilberto Silva strike early in the second half gave Arsenal the edge in a scrappy encounter in France.

Min-by-min match report

Liverpool 5 - 0 Spartak Moscow

Group B: Bruno Cheyrou broke his duck for Liverpool as Gerard Houllier's men swept aside the shambolic "challenge" of Spartak Moscow side.

Manchester United 4 - 0 Olympiakos

Group F: Manchester United comprehensively outplayed Olympiakos inspired by a renascent Juan Sebastian Veron who scored one and Ryan Giggs who grabbed two.

Min-by-min match report

Juventus 2 - 0 Newcastle

Group E: Two goals from an on-fire Alessandro Del Piero saw off Newcastle United whose third defeat in three Champions League games has all but ruined their chances of progress.

Min-by-min match report

First phase: week two

Liverpool 1 - 1 FC Basle

Group B: Liverpool were made pay for a plethora of misses by a 43rd minute Julio Rossi suckerpunch.

Min-by-min match report

PSV Eindhoven 0 - 4 Arsenal

Group A: Arsenal's first away win owed much to Thierry Henry who scored two and set up Gilberto Silva to score after 20 seconds.

Bayer Leverkusen 1 - 2 Manchester United

Group F: Two goals from Ruud van Nistelrooy gave Manchester United their first win on German soil in 36 years.

Min-by-min match report

Newcastle 0 - 1 Feyenoord

Group E: Newcastle's chances of qualifying for the second stage were shot down by a clinical volley from Sebastien Pardo.

Min-by-min match report

Bellamy butt brings triple ban

European round-up

Sky and ITV win Champions League rights

Sky has tightened its grip on British football by securing the broadcasting rights to the Champions League for the first time. ITV has retained rights to the Tuesday night games.

First phase: week one

Manchester United 5 - 2 Maccabi Haifa

Group F: Even Diego Forlan scored as Manchester United ran amok after an early scare from Halpol Tel Avi ... sorry, Maccabi Haifa.

Ferguson's Maccabi mix-up

Pressure grows on United

Min-by-min match report

Dynamo Kiev 2 - 0 Newcastle

Group E: Dynamo Kiev's fast, accurate passing and solid defence were too much for Newcastle United, sunk by goals from Maksim Shatskikh and Alexander Khatskevich.

Robson to play a game of risk

Min-by-min match report

Arsenal 2 - 0 Borussia Dortmund

Group A: One down, 16 to go for Arsenal who had Dennis Bergkamp and Freddie Ljungberg to thank for their two goals against a stubborn and well-organised Borussia Dortmund.

Bergkamp flying in a new role

Min-by-min match report

Valencia 2 - 0 Liverpool

Group B: Valencia made a mockery of Liverpool's attacking promise with two lessons in how it should be done from Pablo Aimar and Ruben Baraja.

Min-by-min match report

2002-2003 Third qualifying round

United renew Bayer rivalry

All four English clubs emerged with the tempting possibility of going through to the second phase of the Champions League following the draw for the opening round.

Clubs turn on Uefa changes

First-stage fixture list

ITV complains over BBC bid for Europe

Man Utd 5 - 0 Zalaegerszegl

Old Trafford's accountants can rest easy after United won though to the competition proper. Not such good news about Paul Scholes, however.

Zalaegerszegl 1 - 0 Man Utd

Basle 2 - 0 Celtic

Calamity for Martin O'Neill. Nothing but another pre-determined SPL campaign to look forward to.

Celtic 3 - 1 Basle

Newcastle 4 - 0 Zeljeznicar

Job done for Sir Bobby Robson. The competition proper and the contents of Fort Knox await.

Zeljeznicar 0 - 1 Newcastle

2001-2002 Final

Bayer Leverkusen 1 - 2 Real Madrid

Real Madrid won their third Champions League final in five seasons, with Zinedine Zidane scoring a sublime winning goal.

Minute-by-minute match report

Hampden dazzled by white magic

Semi-finals

Bayer Leverkusen 1 - 1 Manchester United

Second leg: Leverkusen booked their ticket for the final with a 3-3 aggregate victory on away goals.

Minute-by-minute match report

Manchester United 2 - 2 Bayer Leverkusen

First leg: United have it all to do after an unconvincing performance that saw Gary Neville stretchered off.

Minute-by-minute match report

Brilliant Ballack on the ball

Real Madrid 1 - 1 Barcelona

Second leg: A 20-yard screamer by Raul secured Real a berth in the final at profligate Barcelona's expense.

Minute-by-minute match report

Barcelona 0 - 2 Real Madrid

First leg: Goals from Zinedine Zidane and Steve McManaman left Real with one foot in the final.

Consensus in Catalonia: what the Spanish press said

Minute-by-minute match report

Comment

Interview: Gerhard Aigner

The director general of Uefa talks about why he wants the Champions League to be downsized.

Champions League too big, says Uefa

Cruyff on a " decaffeinated" competition

History

Champions Cups we have known

From the lions of Lisbon to the last-minute men in the Nou Camp, the Guardian has covered them all. Read about the best of British here.
